conclusion: Problem involves a truck and a bus braking simultaneously, initially 30 meters apart.
v-t graph with velocity in m/s on y-axis and time in seconds on x-axis; two lines for truck and bus.
Truck's line starts at 40 m/s and decreases linearly to 0 m/s by 15 seconds.
Bus's line starts at 30 m/s and decreases linearly to 0 m/s by 30 seconds.
Lines intersect at around 10 seconds with velocity around 20 m/s.
Area under each curve represents displacement of each vehicle.
Need to find displacements of truck and bus from start of braking until they stop.
Equation for velocity of truck: v_truck(t) = (-8/3) * t + 40.
Equation for velocity of bus: v_bus(t) = -t + 30.
Distance between truck and bus: distance(t) = s_bus(t) - s_truck(t) + 30.
